title: Transport
description: Ozonation of vehicles ensures sanitary safety of passenger transport, disinfection of cargo containers and an eco-friendly alternative to chemical fumigation.

public-buses.title: Buses
public-buses.content:
Daily ozonation of passenger buses reduces infection risk, removes unpleasant odors and creates a comfortable environment for passengers. Treatment is done between runs or at night in the depot.

Ozone disinfects all interior surfaces: handrails, seats, walls, floor and ceiling. The gas penetrates seat upholstery, floor coverings and ventilation — everywhere bacteria and viruses can accumulate.

Treatment: 20–40 minutes with windows and doors closed. The generator is placed at maximum height inside. After treatment, ventilate 15–20 minutes or use the ventilation system. The process can be automated.

Equipment can run from the bus power (12V or 24V) or from 220V in the depot. Mobile generators can treat several buses. No consumables reduce operating costs.

intro.text1: Urban public transport is an environment with high contact intensity between people. Hundreds of passengers pass through the bus interior daily, touching handrails, seats, stop buttons. During epidemics, the risk of infection transmission increases manyfold.
intro.text2: Ozonation provides deep disinfection of all interior surfaces, including hard-to-reach areas: upholstery gaps, ventilation system, space under seats. Unlike wiping with disinfectants, ozone gas penetrates everywhere and leaves no chemical residues.

highlight1.title: For fleet operators:
highlight1.text: Ozonation can be done at the depot at night, between runs, or during technical breaks. One mobile ozonator treats 10-15 buses per shift — significant savings compared to hiring additional cleaning staff.

sanitationProblems.title: Sanitation issues in public transport
sanitationProblems.text: The passenger bus interior is a favorable environment for microorganism growth. Engine heat, humidity from passenger breathing, and organic contamination create ideal conditions for bacteria, viruses, and fungi.

items.handrails: Handrails and handles — main source of contact infection transmission
items.upholstery: Fabric seat upholstery absorbs moisture, odors, and microorganisms
items.ventilation: Ventilation system spreads aerosol particles throughout the interior
items.flooring: Floor coverings accumulate dirt and pathogens from shoes
items.hardToReach: Hard-to-reach areas are not treated during regular cleaning

technology.title: Bus ozonation technology
technology.text: Bus interior ozonation is a simple procedure that does not require special staff qualifications. The main thing is to follow the treatment regime and safety rules.

preparation.title: Interior preparation
preparation.description: Close all windows and doors. If necessary, perform preliminary wet cleaning to remove large contaminants.

placement.title: Ozonator placement
placement.description: Install the ozonator in the center of the interior or in the aisle at maximum height. Connect to electrical network (220V/230V) or external power source.

ozonation.title: Ozonation
ozonation.description: Turn on the ozonator, leave the interior and close the door. Treatment time 20-40 minutes depending on volume and contamination level.

ventilation.title: Ventilation
ventilation.description: Open all doors and windows, turn on standard ventilation. Ventilate for 15-20 minutes until ozone is completely removed.

technology.highlight: After ventilation, a light fresh smell remains in the interior — ozone completely decomposes to oxygen. The bus is ready to go on route without additional treatment.

treatmentModes.title: Treatment modes for fleets

table.caption: Recommended ozonation modes for urban buses

treatmentModes.text: When choosing a mode, consider route load, season (more intensive treatment during epidemics), interior condition. Regular ozonation reduces the need for deep treatment.

pathogenEfficiency.title: Efficiency against pathogens
pathogenEfficiency.text: Ozone destroys a wide range of microorganisms relevant to public transport:

table.caption: Ozone efficiency against pathogens in bus interior

odorRemoval.title: Interior odor removal
odorRemoval.text: In addition to disinfection, ozonation effectively removes unpleasant odors that accumulate in the bus interior:

items.sweat: Sweat and human body odor from high passenger flow
items.food: Food odors from items passengers carry
items.tobacco: Tobacco smoke from clothing of smoking passengers
items.musty: Musty odor from damp upholstery and floor coverings
items.ac: Odors from air conditioning system with accumulated mold
items.specific: Specific odors after transporting certain passenger categories

odorRemoval.text2: Ozone oxidizes odor molecules rather than masking them. The result is truly clean air, not a mixture of odors with fragrance. This is especially appreciated by morning route passengers.

night.title: Night treatment
night.description: Buses are ozonated at the depot from 23:00 to 05:00. One operator treats the entire fleet

shiftChange.title: Between shifts
shiftChange.description: Express treatment during driver shift changes. 15-20 minutes — and the bus is ready for the next run

terminal.title: At terminal stops
terminal.description: Compact ozonator runs from bus power during terminal stop

noDowntime.title: No bus downtime
noDowntime.description: Ozonation does not require taking vehicles out of service — treatment during standard breaks

highlight.title: Calculation example:
highlight.text: Fleet of 50 buses. Daily manual treatment requires 5-6 cleaners. With ozonators, 1 operator + 3-4 mobile units handle it. Equipment payback period — 4-6 months due to savings on staff and consumables.

equipment.title: Equipment for fleets
equipment.text: Mobile and wall-mounted ozonators are used for urban bus ozonation:

items.mobile: Mobile ozonators (5-30 g/h) — carried between buses, universal
items.wall: Wall-mounted ozonators (10-20 g/h) — installed permanently in interior
items.power220: 220V/230V power — from electrical network, no external connection needed
items.powerDepot: 220V power — for treatment at depot from fixed network
items.automation: Timers and remote control — process automation

compliance.title: Regulatory compliance
compliance.text: Passenger transport ozonation complies with requirements:

items.sanpin: SanPiN 2.1.2.2645-10 — requirements for transport sanitary condition
items.rospotrebnadzor: Rospotrebnadzor methodological recommendations for transport disinfection
items.regional: Regional requirements for public transport sanitation

highlight.title: Documentation:
highlight.text: Keep an ozonation log with date, time, bus number, and treatment parameters. This confirms compliance with sanitary norms during inspections.

safety.title: Safety rules
safety.text: Ozone in high concentrations is harmful to breathe. Follow safety rules:

items.noPeople: Treatment only when no people are in the interior
items.exit: Leave the bus immediately after turning on the ozonator
items.noOpen: Do not open doors until treatment cycle is complete
items.ventilation: After treatment — mandatory ventilation for 15-20 minutes
items.respirator: If early entry is necessary — use respirator with carbon filter
items.storage: Store ozonator in a ventilated room

railway.title: Railway carriages
railway.shortDesc: Treatment of passenger and freight cars
railway.content:
Railway carriage ozonation is used to disinfect compartments, open coaches and toilets, and to treat freight cars between runs. It effectively removes odors and destroys pathogens.

Passenger cars have high occupancy and limited ventilation. Ozonation in the depot between runs provides deep disinfection of all surfaces and textiles: shelves, curtains, carpeting.

Toilet treatment with ozone is especially effective: the gas neutralizes odors at the molecular level and destroys bacteria in hard-to-reach areas. The result is clean, fresh spaces without harsh chemicals.

Freight cars are ozonated to remove odors from previous cargo and to prepare for sensitive goods. Ozonation is an eco-friendly alternative to chemical treatment and leaves no residues on walls.

intro.text: Railway carriages are enclosed spaces where passengers spend from several hours to several days. In compartment and open coaches, people sleep on shared bunks, use shared toilets, and breathe recirculated air. This creates ideal conditions for infection spread.
intro.text2: Ozonation is the only method that provides complete carriage disinfection, including ventilation systems, mattresses, curtains and hard-to-reach areas. The gas penetrates everywhere that a disinfectant cloth cannot reach.

highlight1.title: For railway depots:
highlight1.text: Ozonation fits into standard carriage turnover. While a carriage waits for the next run, it is treated. No additional downtime is needed, no special cleaning staff required.

sanitation.title: Sanitation specifics in trains
sanitation.text: Passenger carriages have specific problems that are difficult to solve with traditional cleaning:
items: Textile elements (mattresses, pillows, curtains) absorb odors and microorganisms
Ventilation systems recirculate air, spreading pathogens between compartments
Toilets with limited water are difficult to keep clean
Carpeting accumulates dust, dirt and organic contamination
Inter-car vestibules and passages are high-contamination zones
Open coaches have open space with shared ventilation

technology.title: Carriage ozonation technology
technology.text: Passenger carriage treatment is done in the depot between runs. The method depends on carriage type and objectives.

steps.title: Preliminary cleaning
steps.description: Remove trash, change bed linens, wet cleaning. Ozone works more effectively on clean surfaces.

steps.title: Carriage sealing
steps.description: Close all windows, doors, inter-car passages. Turn off supply ventilation, leave recirculation for ozone distribution.

steps.title: Ozonator placement
steps.description: In compartment cars — 2-3 ozonators in the corridor. In open coaches — 3-4 ozonators along the aisle. In toilets — separate units.

steps.title: Ozonation
steps.description: Turn on ozonators, leave the carriage, close the door. Treatment time 30-60 minutes depending on contamination level.

steps.title: Ventilation
steps.description: Open windows and doors, turn on supply ventilation at full power. Ventilate for 20-30 minutes.

modes.title: Treatment modes by carriage type
modes.highlight: For trains of 10-15 cars, a team method is used: ozonators move sequentially from car to car. While the first cars are ventilating, the last ones are being treated.

toilets.title: Toilet treatment
toilets.text: Toilets in trains are a special focus area. Limited water, high usage intensity, specific odors. Traditional cleaning methods do not fully solve the problem.
items: Ozone destroys bacteria in toilets, sinks, floors and walls
Neutralizes odors at the molecular level, not masking them
Treats hard-to-reach areas: behind toilets, under sinks
Eliminates fungus and mold in corners and joints
Disinfects ventilation grilles and ducts
toilets.text2: Recommended mode: concentration 20-30 mg/m³, time 20-30 minutes. For severe cases — increase time to 45-60 minutes. Compact ozonators of 3-5 g/h are ideal for toilets.

features.title: Train turnover
features.description: Ozonation during standard turnover. While linens are changed — the car is treated

features.title: Night layover
features.description: Trains standing in the depot at night are treated automatically on schedule

features.title: Seasonal peaks
features.description: During high passenger traffic periods — enhanced treatment mode

features.title: Incident treatment
features.description: After transporting a sick passenger — unscheduled deep disinfection

freight.title: Freight car treatment
freight.text: Ozonation is used not only for passenger but also for freight cars:
items: Covered cars — removal of odors from previous cargo
Refrigerated sections — disinfection without chemical residues
Grain cars — pest control
Perishable cargo cars — extended storage periods
Insulated cars — preparation for food transport

highlight.title: For food cargo:
highlight.text: Ozonation is a safe alternative to chemical fumigation. Ozone decays to oxygen, leaving no toxic residues on car walls and not transferring to cargo.

economics.title: Economics for depots

table.caption: Ozonation efficiency calculation for depot (100 cars)

economics.text: Payback period for depot ozonator set — 6-12 months through savings on staff and consumables. Additional benefit — improved passenger reviews of car cleanliness.

equipment.title: Railway transport equipment
equipment.text: Industrial ozonators are used for car treatment:
items: Mobile ozone guns (30-100 g/h) — for whole car treatment
Portable ozonators (10-30 g/h) — for compartments and toilets
Wall-mounted ozonators (5-20 g/h) — for fixed installation in cars
Timer systems — for automatic scheduled treatment
Ozone sensors — for concentration monitoring and safety

safety.title: Depot safety requirements
safety.text: When ozonating cars in the depot, observe safety requirements:
items: Treatment only in absence of people in the car and on adjacent tracks
Post warning signs "Ozonation. Entry prohibited"
Staff must be trained in ozone work
When entering car before ventilation — use respirator
Keep treatment log with car number, time, parameters
If sharp ozone odor is detected — immediately leave the area
safety.warning: Ozone MAC — 0.1 mg/m³. Characteristic "after thunderstorm" odor is detected at concentrations of 0.02-0.05 mg/m³. If you smell ozone — the car is not ready for passenger boarding.

shipping-containers.title: Shipping containers
shipping-containers.content:
Ozonation is an eco-friendly alternative to chemical fumigation of shipping containers. Ozone destroys pests, mold spores and bacteria and removes quarantine odors without toxic residues.

Traditional fumigation with methyl bromide or phosphine leaves toxic residues, requires long degassing and special permits. Ozone decays to oxygen in hours without polluting the environment or cargo.

Ozone is effective against insects at all stages: eggs, larvae, pupae and adults. Treatment is done in a sealed container for 12–24 hours depending on pest type.

After ozonation, the container is ventilated for 2–4 hours to safe levels. The method is approved for containers with food, textiles, wood and other chemically sensitive goods.

intro.text1: Shipping containers are the foundation of international trade. Millions of TEU (twenty-foot equivalents) are transported by sea annually with goods of all categories. Containers often require quarantine treatment: to destroy pest insects, mold, bacteria or remove odors from previous cargo.
intro.text2: Traditional fumigation with methyl bromide or phosphine leaves toxic residues, requires special permits and long degassing. Ozonation is an eco-friendly alternative: ozone decays to pure oxygen without contaminating cargo or the environment.

highlight1.title: Important for importers:
highlight1.text: Container ozonation is recognized by phytosanitary services of many countries as an alternative to chemical fumigation. This allows treatment of cargo sensitive to chemical residues: food products, textiles, electronics.

problems.title: Problems solved by ozonation
problems.text: Shipping containers face a number of problems related to long transport and storage:
items: Pest insects — quarantine species imported with cargo from other countries
Mold and fungi — develop with temperature fluctuations and high humidity
Bacterial contamination — especially relevant for food cargo
Odors — from previous cargo (fish, chemicals, fertilizers) or mold
Quarantine requirements — mandatory treatment before import into the country

technology.title: Container ozonation technology

steps.title: Container inspection
steps.description: Check door seal tightness, ventilation openings. If necessary — temporary sealing with tape or film.

steps.title: Parameter calculation
steps.description: Determine container volume, target pest type, required ozone concentration. Standard 20-foot container — about 33 m³.

steps.title: Equipment connection
steps.description: Install ozonator with gas supply inside container through technical opening or door gap. Seal the entry.

steps.title: Ozonation
steps.description: Supply ozone until target concentration is reached (50-100 mg/m³ for insects). Maintain concentration for 12-24 hours.

steps.title: Degassing
steps.description: Turn off ozonator, open container doors. Natural or forced ventilation for 2-4 hours.

technology.highlight: After degassing, ozone concentration drops to safe levels (<0.1 mg/m³). Cargo is ready for unloading and use without additional treatment.

modes.title: Container treatment modes
modes.text: For quarantine pests (bark beetles, weevils, flour beetles) maximum mode is recommended: 80-100 mg/m³ for 24 hours. This guarantees destruction of insects at all development stages, including eggs inside wood or grain.

table.caption: Destruction of pest insects with ozone (80 mg/m³, 24 hours)

highlight.title: Mechanism of action:
highlight.text: Ozone destroys insect cell membranes at the molecular level. Unlike chemical pesticides, resistance to ozone does not develop — this is a fundamental physicochemical effect.

features.title: Dry containers (DC)
features.description: Standard treatment. 20-foot — 33 m³, 40-foot — 67 m³. Require sealing of ventilation openings.

features.title: Refrigerated (RF)
features.description: Treatment with refrigeration unit off. Good tightness. Caution with electronics.

features.title: Ventilated
features.description: Require temporary sealing of all ventilation openings. Higher ozone consumption.

features.title: Open-top
features.description: Treatment after covering with tarp. Perimeter sealing. Partial leakage possible.

applications.title: Application for various cargo
applications.text: Ozonation is suitable for most cargo categories:
items: Grains and legumes — destruction of storage pests without chemical residues
Nuts and dried fruits — preservation of appearance and taste
Coffee and cocoa — mold neutralization without affecting aroma
Spices — quarantine treatment before import
Textiles — removal of warehouse storage odors, mold
Wood and lumber — destruction of bark beetles and wood borers
Paper and cardboard — prevention of fungal damage

highlight.title: Limitations:
highlight.text: Treat cargo with rubber seals with caution (ozone accelerates rubber aging), unprotected electronics, fresh fruits and vegetables (may be damaged at high concentrations).

economics.title: Ozone fumigation economics
economics.text: With regular container treatment, ozonator equipment payback is 10-20 treatments. For terminals and logistics companies with high container turnover, savings amount to hundreds of thousands of rubles per month.

equipment.title: Equipment for containers
equipment.text: High-capacity industrial ozonators are used for container fumigation:
items: Ozone generators 50-200 g/h — for 20-40 foot containers
Supply systems — hoses, fittings, sealing gaskets
Ozone analyzers — real-time concentration monitoring
Timers and controllers — process automation
Mobile complexes — on trailer or van base

highlight.title: For terminals:
highlight.text: Stationary ozonator complexes allow simultaneous treatment of multiple containers. Pipeline system supplies ozone to containers on the site, central control panel manages the process.

regulatory.title: Regulatory aspects
regulatory.text: Ozonation as a quarantine treatment method is recognized in many countries:
items: ISPM-15 — allows alternative methods for wood packaging treatment
EPA (USA) — ozone registered as antimicrobial agent
EU — ozonation approved for organic products
Rosselkhoznadzor — accepts ozonation certificates for quarantine control
SanPiN — ozone approved for food product disinfection
regulatory.text2: When exporting/importing, check destination country requirements. In most cases, ozonation is accepted as an alternative to chemical fumigation with proper documentation: treatment certificate indicating concentration and exposure time.

safety.title: Safety requirements
items: Treatment only on open areas or ventilated hangars
Fence treatment area, post warning signs
Personnel — at least 10 m from operating ozonator
When entering container before degassing — respirator with carbon filter
Concentration monitoring with analyzer before allowing people
Emergency shutdown — upon detection of leak or malfunction

highlight.title: Ozone MAC:
highlight.text: 0.1 mg/m³ in work zone. At concentrations above 1 mg/m³ — respiratory irritation. At 10+ mg/m³ — health hazard. Always use analyzers for monitoring.

auto-transport.title: Road freight
auto-transport.content:
Ozonation of trucks and vans ensures sanitary safety of cargo, especially important for food. It removes odors from previous loads and disinfects the cargo area.

Refrigerated and insulated vans need careful sanitation. Ozonation destroys bacteria, mold and spores that can spoil products. Treatment is done between runs.

For vans carrying mixed cargo, ozonation removes cross-odors. Smells of fish, chemicals or fertilizers can soak into walls and transfer to other goods. Ozone neutralizes these odors.

Treatment: 30–60 minutes with doors closed. A mobile generator is placed inside the cargo area. After treatment, ventilate 15–20 minutes. For large fleets, fixed ozonation systems in the loading zone are recommended.

intro.text: Commercial road transport — from small vans to long-haul trucks — requires regular sanitary treatment. This is especially critical for food transporters: dairy products, meat, vegetables and fruits. Sanitary standards and HACCP requirements mandate maintaining cargo area cleanliness.
intro.text2: Ozonation is an effective and economical method of fleet sanitary treatment. One mobile ozonator treats 10-15 trucks per shift, runs from vehicle power, requires no consumables. For logistics companies, this is significant savings compared to chemical treatment.

highlight1.title: For fleet managers:
highlight1.text: Integrate ozonation into maintenance schedules. While the driver processes paperwork or rests between runs — the truck is treated. This creates no additional downtime.

types.title: Types of commercial transport
types.text: Ozonation is used for all types of freight road transport:
items: Refrigerators — transport of perishable products with temperature control
Insulated vans — product delivery without active cooling
Curtain-sided semi-trailers — universal freight transport
Solid-body vans — delivery to retail outlets
Specialized vehicles — bread trucks, milk trucks, meat trucks
Container carriers — with installed shipping containers

problems.title: Sanitation problems in freight transport
problems.text: Vehicle cargo areas are contaminated from various sources:
items: Odors from previous cargo — fish, meat, chemicals, fertilizers
Bacterial contamination — from leaking packaging, damaged products
Mold and fungi — when transporting wet cargo, condensation
Insects — brought in with cargo or from warehouses
Dust and dirt — accumulate on floor and body walls
Packaging residues — cardboard, film, tape, pallet strapping
problems.text2: Traditional washing and wiping do not fully solve the problem. Water does not kill bacteria, odors return, mold grows again. Disinfection is needed.

technology.title: Truck treatment technology

steps.title: Emptying the body
steps.description: Unload cargo, remove trash and packaging residues. For heavy contamination — preliminary wet cleaning.

steps.title: Ozonator placement
steps.description: Install ozonator inside the body at maximum height. Connect to electrical network (220V/230V) or external source.

steps.title: Sealing
steps.description: Close doors, gates, hatches. For curtain-sided semi-trailers — lower curtain and secure.

steps.title: Ozonation
steps.description: Turn on ozonator, start timer. Treatment time 20-40 minutes depending on volume and contamination.

steps.title: Ventilation
steps.description: Open doors, turn on refrigerator ventilation (if available). Ventilate for 15-20 minutes.

technology.highlight: After ventilation, the body is ready for loading. Ozone has decayed to oxygen, no chemical residues, cargo is not at risk of contamination.

refrigerators.title: Refrigerator treatment specifics
refrigerators.text: Refrigerators and insulated vans require special attention — they transport food products with strict sanitary requirements.
items: Treatment with refrigeration unit off — ozone does not affect refrigerant
Good insulation tightness increases effectiveness
Ozone does not damage sandwich panels and plastic lining
Entire interior surface treated, including ceiling and floor grooves
Odors absorbed into walls from previous transports are eliminated

highlight.title: For HACCP:
highlight.text: Record each treatment in a log with date, vehicle number, parameters (time, concentration). This is documentary proof of sanitary compliance during audits.

odors.title: Odor elimination
odors.text: One of the main problems in freight transport — odors from previous cargo:
items: Fish and seafood — persistent odor, absorbs into walls
Meat — when packaging is damaged or temperature regime violated
Onions, garlic — sharp odor, transfers to other cargo
Chemicals — fertilizers, household chemicals, technical fluids
Perfumes — strong aromas, incompatible with food cargo
odors.text2: Ozone oxidizes odor molecules, converting them to neutral compounds. This is not masking, but complete elimination. After treatment, the body smells fresh — "like after a thunderstorm".

features.title: After unloading
features.description: While driver processes paperwork and receives next assignment — vehicle is treated

features.title: Before loading
features.description: Preventive treatment before loading sensitive cargo: dairy, meat, vegetables

features.title: Night layover
features.description: Vehicles in the depot are treated at night — ready for run in the morning

features.title: Cargo change
features.description: When switching from one cargo type to another (fish → dairy) — mandatory treatment

economy.title: Fleet economics

table.title: Fleet sanitary treatment method comparison (50 vehicles)

economy.text: When treating 50 vehicles twice a week, savings amount to 100-200 thousand rubles per month. Ozonator payback — 2-4 months. Additional benefit — reduced customer complaints about odors and contamination.

compliance.title: Compliance with sanitary norms
compliance.text: Road freight ozonation complies with requirements:
items: SanPiN 2.3.4.050-96 — food product transport
Technical Regulation TS 021/2011 — food product safety
HACCP — critical control points in logistics
ISO 22000 — food safety management systems
Retail chain requirements for suppliers and carriers

warning.title: Documentation:
warning.text: Keep treatment logs for at least 1 year. During HACCP audits, Rospotrebnadzor inspections or customer claims — this is your protection.

equipment.title: Fleet equipment
equipment.text: For commercial transport treatment, the following are used:
items: Mobile ozonators 5-20 g/h — for vans and medium trucks
Portable ozonators 20-50 g/h — for semi-trailers and large transport
Wall-mounted ozonators — for fixed installation in body
220V/230V modifications — for operation from electrical network without external power
Timer systems — for automatic scheduled treatment

roi.title: ROI for fleet operators
roi.text: Return on investment calculation for fleet of 30 trucks:
items: Investment: 100,000 ₽ (3 ozonators at 30-35 thousand ₽)
Staff savings: 40,000 ₽/month (release of 1-2 cleaners)
Disinfectant savings: 15,000 ₽/month
Downtime reduction: 10,000 ₽/month (quick treatment)
Total savings: ~65,000 ₽/month
Payback period: 1.5-2 months

highlight.title: Additional benefit:
highlight.text: Reputational effect. Clean, odor-free trucks — this is customer confidence in transport quality. Large retail chains and producers choose carriers with confirmed sanitary treatment.

safety.title: Safety requirements
items: Treatment only with closed body and no people inside
Do not turn on ozonator in driver cabin
After treatment — mandatory ventilation before entering body
If early entry needed — respirator with carbon filter
Do not direct ozonator output at rubber seals
Store ozonator in dry ventilated place
